Name: Chuquisaca
Description: Known for its colonial history, beautiful landscapes, and the capital, Sucre, which was once the constitutional capital of Bolivia.

Name: La Paz
Description: Famous for being the highest capital city in the world, La Paz offers a blend of Andean culture, modernity, and breathtaking landscapes.

Name: Santa Cruz
Description: The economic hub of Bolivia, Santa Cruz is known for its agricultural production, thriving businesses, and tropical climate.

Name: Cochabamba
Description: Located in the central part of the country, Cochabamba is known for its beautiful valley, cultural heritage, and agriculture.

Name: Oruro
Description: Known for its rich mining industry and the famous Oruro Carnival, which is a UNESCO cultural heritage event.

Name: Potosí
Description: Famous for its mining history, especially the silver mines of Cerro Rico, which contributed to Spain s wealth during colonial times.

Name: Tarija
Description: Known for its wine production, Tarija is located in the southern part of Bolivia, with a Mediterranean-like climate.

Name: Beni
Description: A lowland region known for its vast wetlands, wildlife, and the capital city, Trinidad.

Name: Pando
Description: Located in the northern part of Bolivia, Pando is known for its Amazon rainforest and biodiversity.
